title: Constantly receiving "Connection Error" when logging in.
body:
Hey, so for the past few days since Patch 6.15, I've been having trouble logging into the game. I would get the connection error that says:

"Connection Failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server. 

Information regarding what may have caused this error can be found here. 

Service availability can be viewed on the League of Legends Server Status web page."

I have tried everything possible to fix the issue.

I repaired my client. Uninstalled and re-installed League. Tried logging into an account on another region. Flushed my DNS and every other solution given from Riot on their support pages and I cannot log in. 

Any help would be highly appreciated.

replies.body:
There are a lot of potential causes for the login issues you've been experiencing, but the guides that *Rineyy* linked are a good place to start in troubleshooting this. Login issues are generally caused by an unstable connection to the server or security authentication issues with local Internet Explorer settings, solutions for which can be found on the aforementioned guides. 

If you should still encounter issues logging in after working through those guides, please let me know.
yep still nothing, i did everything, i run windows 10...idk what to do..would appreciate{{champion:17}}  some hlp

Since you're still encountering this issue after working through those guides, I recommend [submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with our tech team. 

With your submission, I recommend attaching a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) and the link to a completed [Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1).

same here eune ive done anything still the client freezes at loging on... then the connection error comes
my best guess is that the new internet explorer "microsoft edge" for the updated windows has an issue with the client
any RIOTER out there??? could we get some assistance over here?? its been tooo fkn long...

The client still uses Internet Explorer as its backbone.
